items.description: River Windrush from Bourton to Newbridge
items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 

River levels remain high, but are falling slowly, on the River Windrush. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 3/11/24, especially in the Bourton on the Water and Newbridge areas. 

The forecast today is cloudy but dry, and the weather should remain dry into next week. We expect river levels to continue falling, but levels remain sensitive to rainfall. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. We are monitoring the situation. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 4/11/24, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected. 

River levels have fallen on the Ginge Brook in Steventon. Flooding of low lying land remains possible today, 3/11/24. The forecast today is cloudy but dry, and the weather should remain dry into next week. River levels remain sensitive to rainfall. We are monitoring the situation. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 4/11/24, or as the situation changes.
